meanings.definition: Resembling an amoeba in shape or movement.
meanings.sent1: The ameboid creature slowly extended its pseudopods to move forward.
meanings.sent2: The scientist observed the ameboid cell under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The ameboid jelly dessert jiggled on the plate.
meanings.sent4: Her dance was as fluid and ameboid as a flowing river.
meanings.sent5: The ameboid cloud morphed and changed shape in the sky.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to an ameba.
meanings.sent1: The ameboid characteristics of the organism were studied in biology class.
meanings.sent2: The textbook explained the ameboid behavior of the single-celled organism.
meanings.sent3: The ameboid pattern on the fabric resembled tiny single-celled organisms.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts moved in an ameboid manner, constantly changing and adapting.
meanings.sent5: The ameboid structure of the building allowed for flexible expansion.
